Card_1.description: Manish has an outstanding credit card bill of Rs.20,000/- with a minimum payment of Rs.1,000/-. How much should he pay so that he doesn't pay any interest?
Card_1.answer_exp: Only if you pay the entire outstanding amount, no interest will be charged.

Card_2.description: Neha has a total outstanding of Rs.12,000/- on her credit card. Her minimum amount due is Rs.500/-. What is the minimum amount she should pay to avoid any fees or penalties?
Card_2.answer_exp: If you pay the minimum amount, no fees/penalties will be charged, only interest will.

Card_3.description: Omkar buys a mobile phone using EMI for 6 months on his credit card. The mobile phone costs Rs.20,000/-. How much will Omkar actually pay over the 6 months?
Card_3.answer_exp: Buying on EMI costs more because interest is also charged.

Card_4.description: Preeti owes Rs.10,000/- on her credit card, with a minimum payment of Rs.1,000/-. She does not pay a single rupee. Which of these will be the consequence of her non-payment?
Card_4.answer_exp: Paying the minimum amount can prevent late fees and penalties.

Card_5.description:
Quincy and Reema have a credit card with a limit of Rs.50,000/- each. Quincy spends Rs.40,000/-
each month while Reema only spends Rs.10,000/-. Who would have a higher credit score?
Card_5.option_3: c. It would be the same
Card_5.answer_exp: The lower the credit card limit you use, the higher will be your credit score.

Card_6.description:
Sunny and Tina spend Rs.20,000/- each month. Sunny has a credit card with a limit of
Rs.1,00,000/- whereas Tina has one with Rs.1,50,000/-. Who would have a higher credit score?
Card_6.option_3: c. It would be the same
Card_6.answer_exp:
The lower your credit utilization ratio, i.e. the ratio of your expenditure to your credit limit, the higher
your score.

Card_7.description:
Uma has a credit score of 650. She gets one more credit card with a limit of Rs.1,00,000/-, while
keeping her expenses the same. What will happen to her credit score?
Card_7.option_3: c. It will stay the same
Card_7.answer_exp: By increasing your credit limit without changing your expense, you can increase your credit score.

Card_8.description: Vimal has a credit score of 500. However, he has been missing payments on his credit cards since the last two months. What do you think will be the impact on his score?
Card_8.option_3: c. It will stay the same
Card_8.answer_exp: Irregular payment of debts can reduce your credit score.

Card_9.description: Waheeda and Yusuf both have credit cards with the same limit and spend similarly every month. Waheeda got her credit card in 2016 while Yusuf got his in 2010. Who would have a higher credit score?
Card_9.option_3: c. Both will be the same
Card_9.answer_exp: The older your credit history, the higher your score.

Card_10.description:
Anu has one credit card with a limit of Rs.50,000/-, while Amal has two credit cards with limits of
Rs.25,000/- each. They both spend similarly. Who would have a higher credit score?
Card_10.option_3: c. Both will be the same
Card_10.answer_exp: The higher the number of credit cards/debt accounts, the higher the score.
